title.narrative: Segundo Programa de Viviendas para Familias de Bajos Ingresos

description.narrative: El programa tendra 2 componentes: I. la consolidación del modelo de subsidio a la demanda, tanto en el litoral como en el interior del pais. 2. Desarrollo de piloto para promoveerla oferta de vivienda para grupos de bajos ingresos.
The program will have 2 component I. Consolidation the subsidies in both costal area and the interior of the country 2. Piolot Develoment to promote housing suply for low imcome group.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF SOCIAL AFFAIRS AND HOUSING

activity-description.narrative: Subsidies are being allocated for the interior and coastal area of the country for the building of new houses in beneficiaries’ lots. The Program´s subsidy complements beneficiaries´ own savings and/or loans. Low income families who own a plot but do not own a house may apply for a subsidy

Subsidies are being allocated for the interior and coastal area of the country for the construction of new houses. The Program´s subsidy complements beneficiaries´ own savings and/or loans. Low income families who own a plot but do not own a house may apply for a subsidy

Subsidies are being allocated for the interior and coastal area of the country for the improvement of existing houses. The Program´s subsidy complements beneficiaries´ own savings and/or loans. Low income families who own a house in need of renovation may apply for a subsidy.

Subsidies are being allocated for the interior and coastal area of the country for the renovation of existing houses. The Program´s subsidy complements beneficiaries´ own savings and/or loans. Low income families who own a house that needs to be renovated may apply for a subsidy

The PIU and its partners organize ongoing outreach campaigns to reach out to potential beneficiaries. Informative materials such as folders, flyers and infomercials are produced to promote the Low Income Shelter Program, create awareness and inform the community about the program´s eligibility criteria, the products offered (subsidies for housing improvement or new house) and its processes

The Project Implementation Unit (PIU) staff and program partners (NGOs) were trained in adequate construction standards, financial management and environmental issues to contribute to an efficient execution and supervision of the project. Additional training was given on the Management Information System, which guides PIU and NGOs staff along all the process of reviewing and approving subsidy applications.

The Project Implementation Unit staff and program partners (NGOs) were trained on the use of the Program´s Management Information System (MIS), which is programmed with objectively verifiable criteria to determine program eligibility, and guides the user along all the process of reviewing and approving subsidy applications. Additional training about building construction basics, financial management and environmental issues were provided to contribute to an efficient execution of the project.
